channel.title: Auto Cache Downloader Help!
channel.description: Hello, so I set my cachedownload link to drop box and put the link in the cachedownload java file and i compiled and i changed the signlink to the name of the cache in my drive and when i run my client the cache downloads but then says requesting title screen retry in 5...4...3...2...1... and then retry and stuff like that but it says this. [code]java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\testCache\Project_Rsps\.DS_Store (The s ystem cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at CacheDownloader.unzip(CacheDownloader.java:188) at CacheDownloader.unZip(CacheDownloader.java:174) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:77) at client.startUp(client.java:7417) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:101) at client.run(client.java:4807) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Press any key to continue . . .[/code] I dont get what to do from here thanks for helping!

item.title: Auto Cache Downloader Help!
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“Van_Knox, post:9, topic:540039”][quote author=Pure_ link=topic=658882.msg4407118#msg4407118 date=1392334554]
Loading the cache caused an issue when attempting to read a byte, I think the given index in the buffer was not read into? ie buffer-size is 2048 and you tried to access index 36082.
[/quote]
Is there a place in the client folder where i can change it down?[/quote]Point is: something is wrong and I can’t help you since I don’t know enough about your client (even if you did tell me). Now I gave you a pointer, an array was being accessed for an index which is out of its bounds, which I predicted to be the byte-buffer.

Good luck solving this.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Cache Downloader Help!
item.dc:creator: @Van_Knox Van_Knox
item.description:
@Van_Knox wrote:

Pure_:

Loading the cache caused an issue when attempting to read a byte, I think the given index in the buffer was not read into? ie buffer-size is 2048 and you tried to access index 36082.

Is there a place in the client folder where i can change it down?

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Cache Downloader Help!
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Loading the cache caused an issue when attempting to read a byte, I think the given index in the buffer was not read into? ie buffer-size is 2048 and you tried to access index 36082.

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Cache Downloader Help!
item.dc:creator: @Van_Knox Van_Knox
item.description:
@Van_Knox wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:6, topic:540039”][quote author=Van_Knox link=topic=658882.msg4407109#msg4407109 date=1392333556]

[quote author=Pure_ link=topic=658882.msg4407094#msg4407094 date=1392331732]

The file C:\testCache\Project_Rsps.DS_Store is not found. If you renamed the cache make sure to also change it in the source.

Oh u also have to change it in the source didn’t know that do you know what file i could find it in?
[/quote]By searching for the old cache directory and replacing it?

I’ve done that and cant find anything in the source that has to do with the cache the problem is it cant find it i guess but it downloads it to the c drive but wont open it up do u think i probably zipped it incorrectly? or something like that
[/quote]I have told you the issue, it appears to be on line 188 of CacheDownloader.java.[/quote]
Alright well now im getting this error Map Amount: 770 java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 36082 at Stream.readSignedByte(Stream.java:168) at Background.<init>(Background.java:36) at client.startUp(client.java:7484) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:101) at client.run(client.java:4807) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Error: loaderror Unpacking media 80 Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: Auto Cache Downloader Help!

The file C:\testCache\Project_Rsps.DS_Store is not found. If you renamed the cache make sure to also change it in the source.

Oh u also have to change it in the source didn’t know that do you know what file i could find it in?
[/quote]By searching for the old cache directory and replacing it?

I’ve done that and cant find anything in the source that has to do with the cache the problem is it cant find it i guess but it downloads it to the c drive but wont open it up do u think i probably zipped it incorrectly? or something like that[/quote]I have told you the issue, it appears to be on line 188 of CacheDownloader.java.

Read full topic

I’ve done that and cant find anything in the source that has to do with the cache the problem is it cant find it i guess but it downloads it to the c drive but wont open it up do u think i probably zipped it incorrectly? or something like that

@Van_Knox wrote:

Hello, so I set my cachedownload link to drop box and put the link in the cachedownload java file and i compiled and i changed the signlink to the name of the cache in my drive and when i run my client the cache downloads but then says requesting title screen retry in 5…4…3…2…1… and then retry and stuff like that but it says this. java.io.FileNotFoundException: C:\testCache\Project_Rsps\.DS_Store (The s ystem cannot find the path specified) at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(Unknown Source) at CacheDownloader.unzip(CacheDownloader.java:188) at CacheDownloader.unZip(CacheDownloader.java:174) at CacheDownloader.downloadCache(CacheDownloader.java:77) at client.startUp(client.java:7417) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:101) at client.run(client.java:4807) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Press any key to continue . . .
I dont get what to do from here thanks for helping!
